refnamediv.refpurpose: Trading Strategy based on Events in OsMA and MACD Indicators

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: The ATDM strategy proposes a principally event-oriented analysis of trends in the OsMA and MACD indicators, for orchestration of order open and order close events. Furthermore, an orchestration logic is developed, in the strategy, for purpose of limiting risk on event of order open or order close.

sidebar.remark: Both of the _OsMA_ and _MACD_ indicators derive their respective rate values from moving average calculations.

refsect2.title: Orchestration Logic - Open/Close Orchestration

listitem.para: Analyze Historic DOsMA Indicator Rate Data for Determining Time and Rate of Minimum, Zero Crossover, and Maximum of OsMA/Price Ratio Line of the DOsMA Indicator, i.e DOsMA "R Line"

If the Min/Max trend of the DoSMA "R Line" occurs without intermediate "Zero Crossover" in the rate of the DoSMA "R Line"
e.g if the "Min" and "Max" values are both of a numerically negative value, or if both are of a numerically positive value , then place a hold on the order open orchestration.

At the next non-held "Zero crossover" in the DOsMA "R Line," conduct intuitive analysis to determine whether it may be appropriate to open a buy order, a sell order, or no order.
In this event, the role of market rate forecasting may be of a notable relevance.

After event of Open Order, conduct analysis of the MACD indicator's primary rate line. In an ideal market environment, the open order would be held until after the MACD rate line has crossed over the MACD "zero rate", i.e MACD Crossover

After event of MACD crossover, conduct intuitive analysis of the difference of the DOsMA "R line" and the DoSMA "Difference line". In an ideal market environment, a strong convergence of the two indicator lines - following a MACD crossover - may signal an ideal situation for closing any open order.

refsect2.para:
This strategy is made more complicated in some events, such as:
MACD Min/Max trend without MACD Crossover DOsMA rate lines illustrating multiple crossovers within a short duration

When there is a substantial duration beween the respective DoSMA and MACD crossover events, or — failing MACD crossover — beween the respective DOsMA Min/Max events, and when this is in corresponding with a substantial and favorable progress in market rate across the duration, then this strategy may result in an appreciable return on investment.

refsect3.title: Orchestration Holds - Holding before Open

member.remark: Other "Ambiguous Market" Holds - e.g "Multiple DOsMA crossover without MACD Crossover"; "DMACD" or "DOsMA Oscillation near zero"

formalpara.title: Market Spread Hold
formalpara.para:
Calculation in the Market Spread Hold is based on the difference of the magnitude of the Market Spread and the magnitude of a comparable metric, such as:
Difference between Open and Close prices for the present, or immediately previous Market Tick.
As a variation of the previous: Difference between High and Low prices
Difference beween Maximum and Minimum of Price for the present or immediately previous Market Rate Trend.
If applying a calculation based on Price, a single Price Calculation Method may be applied onto the market OHLC data — such as to produce an average of High and Low prices for any single Chart tick as the Price for that Chart Tick. Moreover, the methodology of Chart Tick calculation may vary, as per whether a traditional Candlestick methodology is applied onto the available Open, High, Low, Close data points for the market rate, or such as the Heikin-Ashi Candlestick methodology.

refsect3.para: If the magnitude of the difference of the immediate Ask and Offer prices is numerically greater than the magnitude of the comparable metric, then — as a risk-limiting factor — in the short-duration trading strategy developed here, it may then be advisable to hold before opening any new orders.

member.remark: "Ambiguous Market" Holds - e.g DOsMA crossover without intermediate MACD crossover when strategy is in "Close after MACD crossover" state; DOsMA or MACD crossover in a "Crossover vector" not isomorphic to the open order; DoSMA crossover in a "Crossover vector" not sufficient to illustrate a sustained crossover.

refsect1.title: Case Studies
refsect1.remark: developed primarily in reference to EURUSD and USDCHF currency pairs - may not be advisable for trading onto JPY currency pairs

The development of this strategy was begun in reference to a duration of relatively volatile and consistent trends on EURUSD. Some of the indicator signals applied in this strategy may not be productive to a strong sense of confidence for trading onto an inactive of ambiguous/wild market.
